question.sentence: You can either take a bus or go by train.
The wedding's neither too soon nor too late for my parents.
They can speak neither Dutch nor French.
We can expect either Sue or John to help us.
You can either run or swim: those are the rules.
The money's in neither the red box nor the green one.
The children can either paint or draw.
Shall we keep the piano as neither Ben nor David may want to play it?
From our house, it's easy to get to either the town centre or the station.
You can either stay in France or go to America.
